items.title: Singapore’s ride-hailing boom faces a crisis: driver shortages
items.summary:
- Singapore's economy recovery increases demand for ride-hailing but faces driver shortages.
- Drivers experience stalled earnings due to higher costs and reduced incentives.
- The private-hire car population peaked at 90,383, yet only 54,881 hold driver licenses.
- There are concerns over ride supply during peak times despite overall improvement in 2024.
- Ride shortages have been persistent since the economic recovery post-pandemic.

items.title: India’s 15-minute meal hunger games
items.summary:
- Quick commerce in Indonesia is struggling, with players like Astro no longer promising ultra-fast deliveries.
- In India, quick commerce is thriving, with companies like Zepto, Swiggy, and Zomato scaling up fast food deliveries.
- The trade-offs between speed and partnership conflicts for food delivery companies are scrutinized in the latest analysis.
- A potential Grab-GoTo merger could reshape Indonesia’s digital economy and lead to improved efficiency and competition but also raises regulatory concerns.

items.title: Mobility platform Rapido warned over accessibility issues
items.summary:
- Mobility platform Rapido has been warned regarding its accessibility issues for users.
- The warning comes amid increasing scrutiny over the inclusivity of mobility services.
- Accessibility for users with disabilities is a growing concern in the tech and transportation sectors.

items.title: Series SEA: Who’s investing in the region’s fintech startups?
items.summary:
- Highlights the active investors in Southeast Asia's fintech scene over the past two years.
- Lists firms that have invested in three or more fintech startups in the region within this timeframe.
- Content is a work in progress, encouraging readers to report inaccuracies about investor data.

items.title: Nvidia CEO denies company’s involvement in Intel deal
items.author: Jensen Huang
items.summary:
- Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang stated that the company has not been approached to buy a stake in Intel.
- He dismissed rumors of a consortium acquiring Intel at Nvidia’s developer conference in San Jose.
- Huang emphasized that no one had invited Nvidia to join any discussions regarding Intel and joked about being unaware of such plans.
- His comments clarify Nvidia's position amidst speculation about their involvement in Intel's potential acquisition.

items.title: Indian SaaS firm Fractal backs Asper.AI with $20m investment
items.summary:
- Fractal invested 172 crore rupees (US$20 million) in Asper.AI, an AI-driven supply chain management platform.
- The funding aims to support product development and expand Asper.AI’s global enterprise customer base.
- Fractal, which serves Fortune 500 companies, has raised US$685 million from various investors.
- The investment is part of ongoing speculation regarding Fractal’s potential US$500 million IPO in India, with no recent updates available.

items.title: SoftBank acquires AI data center chipmaker Ampere for $6.5b
items.summary:
- SoftBank Group Corp announced an acquisition of Ampere Computing for $6.5 billion on Mar. 19.
- Ampere, founded in 2018 by former Intel president Renee James, focuses on CPU chips for AI applications in data centers.
- The deal also involves Oracle and Carlyle Group selling their stakes in Ampere, now joining SoftBank's AI chip portfolio under Arm Holdings.

items.title: S Korean battery maker signs $10b deal to power Nissan EVs
items.summary:
- SK On has secured a contract to supply EV batteries to Nissan, marking their first collaboration.
- The agreement involves 99.4 GWh of batteries supplied from 2028 to 2033.
- The supply will support the production of approximately 1 million mid-size EVs.
- The deal is valued at around US$10 billion, with high-nickel battery cell pouches delivered to Nissan’s Canton plant in Mississippi.

items.title: US chipmaker Microchip shares drop after $1.35b stock offering plan
items.summary:
- Microchip Technology's shares fell 3.2% in after-hours trading on March 19 after announcing a $1.35 billion stock offering.
- Prior to the announcement, the stock was up 0.7% at $54.57 but dropped to $52.79 following the news.
- The funds will be used for capped call transactions to limit share dilution and to repay debt from its commercial paper program.
- The company also announced layoffs of 2,000 employees, approximately 9% of its workforce, due to excess inventory and weak demand in the automotive sector.

items.title: US Web3 wallet firm Privy nets $15m funding round
items.summary:
- Privy, a web3 wallet infrastructure company, raised US$15 million in a funding round led by Ribbit Capital.
- This new funding increases total funding to over US$40 million.
- Existing investors include Sequoia Capital, Paradigm, BlueYard, and Coinbase.
- The company plans to double its workforce from 25 to 50 employees in the next 18 months, focusing on product, engineering, legal, and go-to-market teams.

items.title: Chinese spatial tech firm expands globally despite US tensions
items.summary:
- The firm is pushing its global expansion despite ongoing tensions with the US.
- Focus areas include navigating challenges posed by regulatory scrutiny.
- Collaborations and strategic partnerships are key to its international strategy.

items.title: Crypto deals plunge, UAE’s MGX invests $2b in Binance
items.summary:
- Private crypto venture deals fell to 116 in February 2025, a 60% drop from over 300 in October 2024.
- Total investment value in February was stable at around US$1 billion, consistent since October 2022.
- March investment surged to US$2.3 billion, including a US$2 billion investment in Binance by Abu Dhabi’s MGX, marking Binance’s first institutional investment.
- The MGX deal aims to support advancements in AI, blockchain, and financial innovation.

items.title: X raises $1b equity funding, valuation steady at $32b
items.summary:
- Social media platform X raised nearly US$1 billion in equity funding, maintaining a valuation of approximately US$32 billion.
- Elon Musk participated in this funding round alongside Darsana Capital Partners, which previously acquired some of X's debt.
- Some proceeds may be used to reduce the company’s remaining debt, amid challenges including workforce reductions and a decline in advertisers.
- Fidelity Investments has marked down its stake in X by 79% compared to its value during the 2022 buyout, which was valued at US$44 billion including US$12.5 billion in debt.

items.title: AWS genAI exec leaves to build startup
items.author: Raj Aggarwal
items.summary:
- Raj Aggarwal, GM of generative AI at AWS, announced his departure on Mar. 19.
- Contributed to AWS generative AI projects, including Bedrock AI and Amazon Q, achieving a 4.9% increase in pipeline generation.
- Plans to return to entrepreneurship to launch a new company, details not disclosed.

items.title: Nazara acquires full ownership of sports media firm
items.summary:
[Nazara Technologies has acquired full ownership of a sports media firm.]
[Nazara previously held a 51% stake and has now bought the remaining 49%.]
[The acquisition strengthens Nazara's position in the sports media industry.]

items.title: Aramco-backed software firm opens AI center in India
ASML, other European chipmakers push for Chips Act expansion
UAE, US partnership to build $25b gas plants
Greek fintech firm Qualco weighs IPO for Europe, Middle East growth
Chinese AI startup gets $41.5m from gov’t fund
items.summary:
- Zhipu AI, a Chinese AI firm, received a 300 million yuan (US$41.5 million) investment from a government-backed fund in Chengdu.
- This funding is part of China's initiative to enhance domestic AI capabilities.
- Founded in 2019 in Beijing, Zhipu AI has previously secured significant state-backed funding from various sources.
- The company was valued at 20 billion yuan (US$2.77 billion) in July 2024, attracting investments from major companies like Tencent, Meituan, and Xiaomi.
- Zhipu AI plans to develop a regional AI model for Sichuan province named “Zhipu Zhuge,” as well as AI infrastructure, including a model training center and research facilities.
- In January, the US Commerce Department placed Zhipu AI on the export control list, limiting its access to US components.

items.title: Malaysian fintech startup Versa bags $6.8m series A
items.summary:
- Versa has raised 30 million ringgit (US$6.78 million) in series A funding.
- The funding round was led by AHAM Asset Management Berhad with participation from Tengku Fahad Mua’adzam Shah and CEO Teoh Wei-Xiang.
- The funds will be used for expansion and product improvements over the next five years.
- Since launching in 2021, Versa offers nearly 20 funds and has around 300,000 users, facilitating US$112.98 million in savings in 2024.
- The platform has no front-end fees and introduced Versa Quest, enhancing user rewards with returns up to 9.3%.

items.title: Funding Societies secures equity investment from Gobi Partners
items.summary:
- Funding Societies, a digital finance platform for SMEs in Southeast Asia, received an equity investment from Gobi Partners.
- This investment reflects investor confidence in the platform despite fintech sector challenges.
- The funding will enhance financing and payment solutions for underserved SMEs, focusing on AI and automation for improved processes and risk management.

items.title: US fintech Tala secures $150m debt facility
items.author: Shivani Siroya
items.summary:
- US-based fintech company Tala secures a US$150 million debt facility from Neuberger Berman.
- Initial financing is US$75 million, with an option to increase it to US$150 million.
- Funds will be used to expand services for small-business owners in Mexico.
- Tala has over 3 million clients in Mexico and issued over US$500 million in loans in 2024.
- The average loan size is approximately 2,300 pesos (US$115.41).
- Tala operates in Mexico, Southeast Asia, and East Africa, hinting at potential regional expansions this year.

items.title: Japan’s startup funding, as explained in charts
items.summary:
- The article discusses the current state of startup funding in Japan.  
- It is divided into two sections: weekly updates on recent investor activity and macro trends in funding.  
- The article aims to answer questions about new investors, outlier funding rounds, and shifts in investment trends over time.

items.title: UAE gametech startup PlaysOut raises $7m seed funding
items.author: Jassem Osseiran, Jimmie Jeremejev
items.summary:
- PlaysOut, a UAE-based gametech startup, raised $7 million in seed funding, valuing the company at $70 million.
- Key investors include OKX Ventures, KBW Ventures, and Pacific Century Group.
- The funds will be used to expand PlaysOut's mini-game ecosystem and establish strategic partnerships in the US, MENA, and Asia.

items.title: Global tech firm Yango Group launches $20m venture fund
items.summary:
- Yango Group launches Yango Ventures, a $20 million corporate venture fund.
- Focus on high-growth regions: Latin America, Sub-Saharan Africa, and MENAP (Middle East, North Africa, Pakistan).
- Aims to support early-stage startups in sectors such as O2O, B2B SaaS, and fintech.
- Fund targets startups in seed to series B funding stages.
- Yango Group’s experts will provide guidance to startups for growth.

items.title: EU targets Google, Apple for antitrust violations
items.summary:
- The European Union has initiated action against Google and Apple for violations of the Digital Markets Act (DMA).
- Google is accused of 'self-preferencing' in search results and imposing restrictions on app developers on Google Play.
- Apple is tasked with improving interoperability in iOS for third-party developers.
- Apple claims these requirements may stifle innovation and intends to engage in further discussions with the EU.
- The DMA addresses competition concerns among major tech firms including Google, Apple, Amazon, Meta, and Microsoft, amid rising US-EU tech regulatory tensions.

items.title: Indian healthtech startup launches 50-minute medicine delivery
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Zeno Health has launched a 50-minute medicine delivery service in India after raising US$25 million in its series C funding round.
- The startup operates over 180 retail pharmacy stores integrated with a tech-enabled logistics network, allowing customers to order via app, in-store, or phone, with no minimum order or delivery fee.
- Founded in 2017, Zeno Health focuses on affordable generic medicines and serves over 1.5 million customers through 200 micro-franchises in Maharashtra and West Bengal.
- The company aims to expand operations and enhance technology, having raised over US$56 million from investors like STIC Investments and Lightbox.
- The new service addresses the increasing demand for rapid healthcare delivery, competing with companies like Tata 1mg and PharmEasy, as well as new players like Plazza.

items.title: Sports VC firm gets approval to launch first fund in Abu Dhabi
items.summary:
- Yashaa Global Capital received Financial Services Permission from ADGM to launch its first fund in Abu Dhabi.
- The firm aims to raise US$75 million and begin capital deployment within 45 to 60 days.
- 30% of investments will be directed towards Indian startups, focusing on early to growth-stage startups in sports-related sectors.

items.title: Xpeng to mass-produce robots, flying cars by 2026
items.summary:
- Xpeng plans to mass-produce humanoid robots and flying cars for consumers by the end of 2026.
- The company aims for the robotics industry to surpass the automotive sector in the coming years.
- Initially, robots will be deployed in commercial settings, with the goal of widespread household use in about five years.
- This follows the unveiling of Xpeng's humanoid robot, Iron, in November 2024.
- Recent developments include stock surges and plans for autonomous driving system tests in Hong Kong.

items.title: Nvidia, xAI, join Microsoft in AI infrastructure partnership
items.summary:
- Elon Musk’s xAI and Nvidia joined the AI Infrastructure Partnership announced on Mar. 19.
- The initiative aims for an initial funding of US$30 billion, with potential investments reaching US$100 billion.
- Backed by BlackRock, Microsoft, and MGX, the partnership focuses on specialized data centers for deep learning and data processing.

items.title: Australian EV startup BetterFleet nets $23.7m series A
items.author: Daniel Hilson
items.summary:
- BetterFleet secured US$23.7 million in Series A funding led by Aligned Climate Capital, Ecosystem Integrity Fund, and Remarkable Ventures Climate.
- Funds will be used to expand AI-driven fleet planning technology internationally and enhance product offerings.
- The startup assists over 200 customers in managing their transition to electric vehicles.
- Focus areas include digital twin technology and enhancing AI capabilities.
- BetterFleet is scaling its sales team and automation tools to support channel partners.

items.title: TSMC commits $100b to US expansion
items.summary:
- Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. (TSMC) announced a $100 billion expansion to enhance semiconductor production in the US.
- The announcement was made in March during an event attended by TSMC CEO C.C. Wei.
- This investment reflects a trend among Taiwanese companies increasing their presence in the US, including major firms like Foxconn and smaller companies like Wiwynn Corp. and Quanta Computer Inc.

items.title: Israeli neurotech firm Brain.space nets $14.5m series A
items.summary:
- Brain.space raised US$11 million in a Series A funding round led by Toyota Ventures.
- The company received an additional US$3.5 million non-dilutive grant from the Israel Innovation Authority.
- Total funding amounts to over US$14 million.
- Brain.space focuses on technology that quantifies cognitive and emotional states in real time.
- Funding will enhance data collection infrastructure, improve models, and accelerate commercialization efforts.

items.title: US digital asset firm Utila raises $18m series A
items.summary:
- Utila has raised US$18 million in a Series A funding round led by Nyca Partners.
- This funding increases the total amount raised by Utila to US$30 million since its launch in March 2024.
- The company offers infrastructure for payment providers and financial institutions, including multi-party computation (MPC) wallets.
- Utila has processed US$35 billion in transactions over the past 18 months and aims to expand its global presence and R&D with the new funding.

items.title: These funds have not invested in Indonesia in the past year
items.summary:
- Some funds have ceased investing in Indonesia in the past year, despite having invested in the previous two years.
- Possible reasons include waiting for better market conditions, shifting focus, or the market not being a priority.
- The importance of timing outreach to investors is emphasized.
- The article notes that it's part of a database that welcomes user input for accuracy.

items.title: Spanish sports app Playtomic raises funding, valued at $273m
items.summary:
- Spanish sports app Playtomic successfully raised funding, resulting in a valuation of $273 million.
- The new funding is part of a broader investment trend in sports technology apps.
- The app is designed to enhance user experience in sports activities and bookings.

items.title: Foxconn expects AI server revenue to surpass iPhone sales
items.summary:
- Foxconn predicts its server revenue will exceed iPhone revenue within two years, driven by strong demand for AI servers.
- Chairman Young Liu indicated this shift may occur as soon as this year.
- Liu estimates AI server revenue could reach T$1 trillion (US$30.29 billion) by 2025, accounting for over half of total server revenue.
- Revenue from cloud and networking products is expected to match that of iPhones in the same timeframe.

items.title: SG healthtech startup Kyberlife raises $3m to grow in SEA
items.summary:
- SG healthtech startup Kyberlife has raised $3 million to expand operations in Southeast Asia.
- The funding will be used to enhance technology and increase regional reach.
- This move comes as part of a growing trend of healthtech companies seeking to innovate in the healthcare sector in SEA.

items.title: Kuaishou’s Kling AI adds DeepSeek for creative video tools
items.summary:
- Kuaishou has introduced a new feature called DeepSeek to its Kling AI for enhancing creative video tools.
- DeepSeek aims to optimize video content creation by providing advanced editing and analysis capabilities.
- This development positions Kuaishou competitively within the expanding landscape of AI-powered video solutions.

items.title: Jollibee’s café-buying spree brews a showdown with startups
items.author: Miguel Cordon
items.summary:
- Jollibee Foods Corporation (JFC), valued at US$4.5 billion, is expanding into the café industry.
- Recently opened Tiong Bahru Bakery in Metro Manila, marking its first location outside Singapore.
- Acquired majority stake in South Korea's Compose Coffee for US$238 million, enhancing their coffee portfolio.
- The coffee segment including Compose Coffee and Coffee Bean & Tea Leaf has seen significant growth, contributing to a 17.7% net income increase in 2024.

items.title: EY, Nvidia launch AI platform to boost business efficiency
items.summary:
- EY launched the EY.ai Agentic Platform in partnership with Nvidia.
- The platform incorporates Nvidia’s AI tools, including Nvidia AI Enterprise and AI-Q Blueprint, to enhance operational efficiency.
- It features frameworks like responsible AI using Nvidia NeMo Guardrails and agent creation frameworks based on Nvidia Blueprints.
- Designed for deployment in various environments: client clouds, on-premises systems, and edge computing.

items.title: Mistral AI partners with Singapore’s Defense Ministry
items.summary:
- Singapore’s Ministry of Defence collaborates with Mistral AI to enhance decision-making in the Armed Forces.
- Focus on developing generative AI models, including a tailored mixture-of-experts model.
- The partnership aims to improve information retrieval and AI-driven decision support systems in secure environments.

items.title: Singapore explores AI-driven defense autonomy with Anduril
items.summary:
- Singapore's Defence Science and Technology Agency (DSTA) partners with Anduril Industries and the Republic of Singapore Air Force (RSAF) to enhance mission autonomy.
- The collaboration will utilize Anduril's Lattice for Mission Autonomy software to develop autonomous behaviors for improved decision-making in the field.
- Simulation demonstrations are planned for testing these behaviors over the next year.
- This partnership represents Anduril's first international collaboration for its mission autonomy platform.

items.title: Bukalapak’s financial health in 7 charts
items.summary:
- Bukalapak became Indonesia’s first unicorn listed on the stock exchange in 2021.
- The article presents interactive charts showing Bukalapak's performance metrics.
- Charts are based on earnings releases, available [here](https://about.bukalapak.com/en/investor-relations/#quarterly-results).
- Some previous charts are no longer updated due to lack of data from Bukalapak.
- Content is behind a paywall, requiring a subscription for access.

items.title: Tencent’s Q4 profit up 90% – thanks to its AI, gaming
items.summary:
- Tencent Holdings reports a 90% increase in Q4 profit, reaching 51.3 billion yuan (approximately US$7.1 billion).
- Q4 revenue rose by 11% to 172.4 billion yuan (around US$23.85 billion), exceeding estimates.
- For the full year, profit increased by 68% to 194 billion yuan (around US$26.8 billion), with revenue climbing 8% to 660.2 billion yuan (around US$91.3 billion).
- Financial gains attributed to improved AI-powered advertising and consistent growth in gaming titles.
- Shares closed down 0.2% to HK$540 prior to the earnings release.

items.title: Nvidia unveils ‘first open foundation model for humanoid robots’
items.author: Jim Fan
items.summary:
- Nvidia introduced the GR00T N1, claimed to be the world’s first open foundation model for humanoid robots.
- The model utilizes a neural network for translating visual input into motor actions and has a Diffusion Transformer operating at 120 Hz.
- It has been trained using humanoid teleoperation data, large-scale simulations, and synthetic trajectories.
- Reports indicate a 30% improvement in manipulation tasks applicable to household and industrial environments.
- GR00T N1 is capable of cross-embodiment, demonstrated through adaptation to the HuggingFace LeRobot SO100 robot arm.
- The initiative includes open-sourcing over 300,000 simulated trajectories for research in robotics.

items.title: RedDoorz is getting an upgrade
items.summary:
- RedDoorz achieved its first profitable year in 2024, focusing on core markets.
- The company withdrew from Singapore and Vietnam to concentrate on Indonesia and the Philippines.
- Plans to diversify offerings with upscale choices while delaying IPO until market conditions improve.

items.title: Indonesia’s TikTok Shop reports 40% sales increase in Ramadan
items.author: Melissa Siska Juminto
items.summary:
- TikTok Shop reported a 40% sales increase during Ramadan 2025 compared to the previous year.
- The update was shared by Melissa Siska Juminto, President Director of Tokopedia and TikTok E-Commerce, at an event in Jakarta on Mar. 17, 2025.
- There was a significant increase in local sellers and TikTok users uploaded 72 million short videos in the first week of Ramadan, attributed to increased seller activity and promotional efforts.

items.title: Crypto.com hits $1.5b revenue as crypto token debate grows
items.summary:
- Crypto.com reported a revenue of $1.5 billion.
- The growth comes amid ongoing debates regarding cryptocurrency tokens.
- The article discusses the implications of this revenue surge in relation to the crypto market.
